t: John 1
In*p the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.
The*p same was in the beginning with God.
All*p things were made by him; and without him was not any thing made that was made.
In*p him was life; and the life was the light of men.
And*p the light shineth in darkness; and the darkness comprehended it not.
There*p was a man sent from God, whose name was John.
The*p same came for a witness, to bear witness of the Light, that all men through him might believe.
He*p was not that Light, but was sent to bear witness of that Light.
That*p was the true Light, which lighteth every man that cometh into the world.
He*p was in the world, and the world was made by him, and the world knew him not.
He*p came unto his own, and his own received him not.
But*p as many as received him, to them gave he power to become the sons of God, even to them that believe on his name:
Which*p were born, not of blood, nor of the will of the flesh, nor of the will of man, but of God.
And*p the Word was made flesh, and dwelt among us, (and we beheld his glory, the glory as of the only begotten of the Father,) full of grace and truth.
John*p bare witness of him, and cried, saying, This was he of whom I spake, He that cometh after me is preferred before me: for he was before me.
And*p of his fulness have all we received, and grace for grace.
For*p the law was given by Moses, but grace and truth came by Jesus Christ.
No*p man hath seen God at any time; the only begotten Son, which is in the bosom of the Father, he hath declared him.
And*p this is the record of John, when the Jews sent priests and Levites from Jerusalem to ask him, Who art thou?
And*p he confessed, and denied not; but confessed, I am not the Christ.
And*p they asked him, What then? Art thou Elias? And he saith, I am not. Art thou that prophet? And he answered, No.
Then*p said they unto him, Who art thou? that we may give an answer to them that sent us. What sayest thou of thyself?
He*p said, I am the voice of one crying in the wilderness, Make straight the way of the Lord, as said the prophet Esaias.
And*p they which were sent were of the Pharisees.
And*p they asked him, and said unto him, Why baptizest thou then, if thou be not that Christ, nor Elias, neither that prophet?
John*p answered them, saying, I baptize with water: but there standeth one among you, whom ye know not;
He*p it is, who coming after me is preferred before me, whose shoe's latchet I am not worthy to unloose.
These*p things were done in Bethabara beyond Jordan, where John was baptizing.
The*p next day John seeth Jesus coming unto him, and saith, Behold the Lamb of God, which taketh away the sin of the world.
This*p is he of whom I said, After me cometh a man which is preferred before me: for he was before me.
And*p I knew him not: but that he should be made manifest to Israel, therefore am I come baptizing with water.
And*p John bare record, saying, I saw the Spirit descending from heaven like a dove, and it abode upon him.

And*p I knew him not: but he that sent me to baptize with water, the same said unto me, Upon whom thou shalt see the Spirit descending, and remaining on him, the same is he which baptizeth with the Holy Ghost.
And*p I saw, and bare record that this is the Son of God.
Again*p the next day after John stood, and two of his disciples;
And*p looking upon Jesus as he walked, he saith, Behold the Lamb of God!
And*p the two disciples heard him speak, and they followed Jesus.
Then*p Jesus turned, and saw them following, and saith unto them, What*r seek*r ye?*r They said unto him, Rabbi, (which is to say, being interpreted, Master,) where dwellest thou?
He*p saith unto them, Come*r and*r see.*r They came and saw where he dwelt, and abode with him that day: for it was about the tenth hour.
One*p of the two which heard John speak, and followed him, was Andrew, Simon Peter's brother.
He*p first findeth his own brother Simon, and saith unto him, We have found the Messias, which is, being interpreted, the Christ.
And*p he brought him to Jesus. And when Jesus beheld him, he said, Thou*r art*r Simon*r the*r son*r of*r Jona:*r thou*r shalt*r be*r called*r Cephas,*r which is by interpretation, A stone.
The*p day following Jesus would go forth into Galilee, and findeth Philip, and saith unto him, Follow*r me.*r
Now*p Philip was of Bethsaida, the city of Andrew and Peter.
Philip*p findeth Nathanael, and saith unto him, We have found him, of whom Moses in the law, and the prophets, did write, Jesus of Nazareth, the son of Joseph.
And*p Nathanael said unto him, Can there any good thing come out of Nazareth? Philip saith unto him, Come and see.
Jesus*p saw Nathanael coming to him, and saith of him, Behold*r an*r Israelite*r indeed,*r in*r whom*r is*r no*r guile!*r
Nathanael*p saith unto him, Whence knowest thou me? Jesus answered and said unto him, Before*r that*r Philip*r called*r thee,*r when*r thou*r wast*r under*r the*r fig*r tree,*r I*r saw*r thee.*r
Nathanael*p answered and saith unto him, Rabbi, thou art the Son of God; thou art the King of Israel.
Jesus*p answered and said unto him, Because*r I*r said*r unto*r thee,*r I*r saw*r thee*r under*r the*r fig*r tree,*r believest*r thou?*r thou*r shalt*r see*r greater*r things*r than*r these.*r

And*p he saith unto him, Verily,*r verily,*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r Hereafter*r ye*r shall*r see*r heaven*r open,*r and*r the*r angels*r of*r God*r ascending*r and*r descending*r upon*r the*r Son*r of*r man.*r
John 2
And*p the third day there was a marriage in Cana of Galilee; and the mother of Jesus was there:
And*p both Jesus was called, and his disciples, to the marriage.
And*p when they wanted wine, the mother of Jesus saith unto him, They have no wine.
Jesus*p saith unto her, Woman,*r what*r have*r I*r to*r do*r with*r thee?*r mine*r hour*r is*r not*r yet*r come.*r
His*p mother saith unto the servants, Whatsoever he saith unto you, do it.
And*p there were set there six waterpots of stone, after the manner of the purifying of the Jews, containing two or three firkins apiece.
Jesus*p saith unto them, Fill*r the*r waterpots*r with*r water.*r And they filled them up to the brim.
And*p he saith unto them, Draw*r out*r now,*r and*r bear*r unto*r the*r governor*r of*r the*r feast.*r And they bare it.
When*p the ruler of the feast had tasted the water that was made wine, and knew not whence it was: (but the servants which drew the water knew;) the governor of the feast called the bridegroom,
And*p saith unto him, Every man at the beginning doth set forth good wine; and when men have well drunk, then that which is worse: but thou hast kept the good wine until now.
This*p beginning of miracles did Jesus in Cana of Galilee, and manifested forth his glory; and his disciples believed on him.
After*p this he went down to Capernaum, he, and his mother, and his brethren, and his disciples: and they continued there not many days.
And*p the Jews' passover was at hand, and Jesus went up to Jerusalem,
And*p found in the temple those that sold oxen and sheep and doves, and the changers of money sitting:
And*p when he had made a scourge of small cords, he drove them all out of the temple, and the sheep, and the oxen; and poured out the changers' money, and overthrew the tables;
And*p said unto them that sold doves, Take*r these*r things*r hence;*r make*r not*r my*r Father's*r house*r an*r house*r of*r merchandise.*r
And*p his disciples remembered that it was written, The zeal of thine house hath eaten me up.
Then*p answered the Jews and said unto him, What sign shewest thou unto us, seeing that thou doest these things?
Jesus*p answered and said unto them, Destroy*r this*r temple,*r and*r in*r three*r days*r I*r will*r raise*r it*r up.*r
Then*p said the Jews, Forty and six years was this temple in building, and wilt thou rear it up in three days?
But*p he spake of the temple of his body.
When*p therefore he was risen from the dead, his disciples remembered that he had said this unto them; and they believed the scripture, and the word which Jesus had said.
Now*p when he was in Jerusalem at the passover, in the feast day, many believed in his name, when they saw the miracles which he did.
But*p Jesus did not commit himself unto them, because he knew all men,
And*p needed not that any should testify of man: for he knew what was in man.
John 3
There*p was a man of the Pharisees, named Nicodemus, a ruler of the Jews:
The*p same came to Jesus by night, and said unto him, Rabbi, we know that thou art a teacher come from God: for no man can do these miracles that thou doest, except God be with him.
Jesus*p answered and said unto him, Verily,*r verily,*r I*r say*r unto*r thee,*r Except*r a*r man*r be*r born*r again,*r he*r cannot*r see*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God.*r
Nicodemus*p saith unto him, How can a man be born when he is old? can he enter the second time into his mother's womb, and be born?
Jesus*p answered, Verily,*r verily,*r I*r say*r unto*r thee,*r Except*r a*r man*r be*r born*r of*r water*r and*r of*r the*r Spirit,*r he*r cannot*r enter*r into*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God.*r
That*rp which*r is*r born*r of*r the*r flesh*r is*r flesh;*r and*r that*r which*r is*r born*r of*r the*r Spirit*r is*r spirit.*r
Marvel*rp not*r that*r I*r said*r unto*r thee,*r Ye*r must*r be*r born*r again.*r

The*rp wind*r bloweth*r where*r it*r listeth,*r and*r thou*r hearest*r the*r sound*r thereof,*r but*r canst*r not*r tell*r whence*r it*r cometh,*r and*r whither*r it*r goeth:*r so*r is*r every*r one*r that*r is*r born*r of*r the*r Spirit.*r
Nicodemus*p answered and said unto him, How can these things be?
Jesus*p answered and said unto him, Art*r thou*r a*r master*r of*r Israel,*r and*r knowest*r not*r these*r things?*r
Verily,*rp verily,*r I*r say*r unto*r thee,*r We*r speak*r that*r we*r do*r know,*r and*r testify*r that*r we*r have*r seen;*r and*r ye*r receive*r not*r our*r witness.*r
If*rp I*r have*r told*r you*r earthly*r things,*r and*r ye*r believe*r not,*r how*r shall*r ye*r believe,*r if*r I*r tell*r you*r of*r heavenly*r things?*r
And*rp no*r man*r hath*r ascended*r up*r to*r heaven,*r but*r he*r that*r came*r down*r from*r heaven,*r even*r the*r Son*r of*r man*r which*r is*r in*r heaven.*r
And*rp as*r Moses*r lifted*r up*r the*r serpent*r in*r the*r wilderness,*r even*r so*r must*r the*r Son*r of*r man*r be*r lifted*r up:*r
That*rp whosoever*r believeth*r in*r him*r should*r not*r perish,*r but*r have*r eternal*r life.*r
For*rp God*r so*r loved*r the*r world,*r that*r he*r gave*r his*r only*r begotten*r Son,*r that*r whosoever*r believeth*r in*r him*r should*r not*r perish,*r but*r have*r everlasting*r life.*r
For*rp God*r sent*r not*r his*r Son*r into*r the*r world*r to*r condemn*r the*r world;*r but*r that*r the*r world*r through*r him*r might*r be*r saved.*r

He*rp that*r believeth*r on*r him*r is*r not*r condemned:*r but*r he*r that*r believeth*r not*r is*r condemned*r already,*r because*r he*r hath*r not*r believed*r in*r the*r name*r of*r the*r only*r begotten*r Son*r of*r God.*r
And*rp this*r is*r the*r condemnation,*r that*r light*r is*r come*r into*r the*r world,*r and*r men*r loved*r darkness*r rather*r than*r light,*r because*r their*r deeds*r were*r evil.*r
For*rp every*r one*r that*r doeth*r evil*r hateth*r the*r light,*r neither*r cometh*r to*r the*r light,*r lest*r his*r deeds*r should*r be*r reproved.*r
But*rp he*r that*r doeth*r truth*r cometh*r to*r the*r light,*r that*r his*r deeds*r may*r be*r made*r manifest,*r that*r they*r are*r wrought*r in*r God.*r
After*p these things came Jesus and his disciples into the land of Judaea; and there he tarried with them, and baptized.
And*p John also was baptizing in Aenon near to Salim, because there was much water there: and they came, and were baptized.
For*p John was not yet cast into prison.
Then*p there arose a question between some of John's disciples and the Jews about purifying.
And*p they came unto John, and said unto him, Rabbi, he that was with thee beyond Jordan, to whom thou barest witness, behold, the same baptizeth, and all men come to him.
John*p answered and said, A man can receive nothing, except it be given him from heaven.
Ye*p yourselves bear me witness, that I said, I am not the Christ, but that I am sent before him.
He*p that hath the bride is the bridegroom: but the friend of the bridegroom, which standeth and heareth him, rejoiceth greatly because of the bridegroom's voice: this my joy therefore is fulfilled.
He*p must increase, but I must decrease.
He*p that cometh from above is above all: he that is of the earth is earthly, and speaketh of the earth: he that cometh from heaven is above all.
And*p what he hath seen and heard, that he testifieth; and no man receiveth his testimony.
He*p that hath received his testimony hath set to his seal that God is true.
For*p he whom God hath sent speaketh the words of God: for God giveth not the Spirit by measure unto him.
The*p Father loveth the Son, and hath given all things into his hand.
He*p that believeth on the Son hath everlasting life: and he that believeth not the Son shall not see life; but the wrath of God abideth on him.
John 4
When*p therefore the Lord knew how the Pharisees had heard that Jesus made and baptized more disciples than John,
(Though*p Jesus himself baptized not, but his disciples,)
He*p left Judaea, and departed again into Galilee.
And*p he must needs go through Samaria.
Then*p cometh he to a city of Samaria, which is called Sychar, near to the parcel of ground that Jacob gave to his son Joseph.
Now*p Jacob's well was there. Jesus therefore, being wearied with his journey, sat thus on the well: and it was about the sixth hour.
There*p cometh a woman of Samaria to draw water: Jesus saith unto her, Give*r me*r to*r drink.*r
(For*p his disciples were gone away unto the city to buy meat.)
Then*p saith the woman of Samaria unto him, How is it that thou, being a Jew, askest drink of me, which am a woman of Samaria? for the Jews have no dealings with the Samaritans.

Jesus*p answered and said unto her, If*r thou*r knewest*r the*r gift*r of*r God,*r and*r who*r it*r is*r that*r saith*r to*r thee,*r Give*r me*r to*r drink;*r thou*r wouldest*r have*r asked*r of*r him,*r and*r he*r would*r have*r given*r thee*r living*r water.*r
The*p woman saith unto him, Sir, thou hast nothing to draw with, and the well is deep: from whence then hast thou that living water?
Art*p thou greater than our father Jacob, which gave us the well, and drank thereof himself, and his children, and his cattle?
Jesus*p answered and said unto her, Whosoever*r drinketh*r of*r this*r water*r shall*r thirst*r again:*r

But*rp whosoever*r drinketh*r of*r the*r water*r that*r I*r shall*r give*r him*r shall*r never*r thirst;*r but*r the*r water*r that*r I*r shall*r give*r him*r shall*r be*r in*r him*r a*r well*r of*r water*r springing*r up*r into*r everlasting*r life.*r
The*p woman saith unto him, Sir, give me this water, that I thirst not, neither come hither to draw.
Jesus*p saith unto her, Go,*r call*r thy*r husband,*r and*r come*r hither.*r
The*p woman answered and said, I have no husband. Jesus said unto her, Thou*r hast*r well*r said,*r I*r have*r no*r husband:*r
For*rp thou*r hast*r had*r five*r husbands;*r and*r he*r whom*r thou*r now*r hast*r is*r not*r thy*r husband:*r in*r that*r saidst*r thou*r truly.*r
The*p woman saith unto him, Sir, I perceive that thou art a prophet.
Our*p fathers worshipped in this mountain; and ye say, that in Jerusalem is the place where men ought to worship.
Jesus*p saith unto her, Woman,*r believe*r me,*r the*r hour*r cometh,*r when*r ye*r shall*r neither*r in*r this*r mountain,*r nor*r yet*r at*r Jerusalem,*r worship*r the*r Father.*r
Ye*rp worship*r ye*r know*r not*r what:*r we*r know*r what*r we*r worship:*r for*r salvation*r is*r of*r the*r Jews.*r

But*rp the*r hour*r cometh,*r and*r now*r is,*r when*r the*r true*r worshippers*r shall*r worship*r the*r Father*r in*r spirit*r and*r in*r truth:*r for*r the*r Father*r seeketh*r such*r to*r worship*r him.*r
God*rp is*r a*r Spirit:*r and*r they*r that*r worship*r him*r must*r worship*r him*r in*r spirit*r and*r in*r truth.*r
The*p woman saith unto him, I know that Messias cometh, which is called Christ: when he is come, he will tell us all things.
Jesus*p saith unto her, I*r that*r speak*r unto*r thee*r am*r he.*r
And*p upon this came his disciples, and marvelled that he talked with the woman: yet no man said, What seekest thou? or, Why talkest thou with her?
The*p woman then left her waterpot, and went her way into the city, and saith to the men,
Come,*p see a man, which told me all things that ever I did: is not this the Christ?
Then*p they went out of the city, and came unto him.
In*p the mean while his disciples prayed him, saying, Master, eat.
But*p he said unto them, I*r have*r meat*r to*r eat*r that*r ye*r know*r not*r of.*r
Therefore*p said the disciples one to another, Hath any man brought him ought to eat?
Jesus*p saith unto them, My*r meat*r is*r to*r do*r the*r will*r of*r him*r that*r sent*r me,*r and*r to*r finish*r his*r work.*r

Say*rp not*r ye,*r There*r are*r yet*r four*r months,*r and*r then*r cometh*r harvest?*r behold,*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r Lift*r up*r your*r eyes,*r and*r look*r on*r the*r fields;*r for*r they*r are*r white*r already*r to*r harvest.*r
And*rp he*r that*r reapeth*r receiveth*r wages,*r and*r gathereth*r fruit*r unto*r life*r eternal:*r that*r both*r he*r that*r soweth*r and*r he*r that*r reapeth*r may*r rejoice*r together.*r
And*rp herein*r is*r that*r saying*r true,*r One*r soweth,*r and*r another*r reapeth.*r
I*rp sent*r you*r to*r reap*r that*r whereon*r ye*r bestowed*r no*r labour:*r other*r men*r laboured,*r and*r ye*r are*r entered*r into*r their*r labours.*r
And*p many of the Samaritans of that city believed on him for the saying of the woman, which testified, He told me all that ever I did.
So*p when the Samaritans were come unto him, they besought him that he would tarry with them: and he abode there two days.
And*p many more believed because of his own word;
And*p said unto the woman, Now we believe, not because of thy saying: for we have heard him ourselves, and know that this is indeed the Christ, the Saviour of the world.
Now*p after two days he departed thence, and went into Galilee.
For*p Jesus himself testified, that a prophet hath no honour in his own country.
Then*p when he was come into Galilee, the Galilaeans received him, having seen all the things that he did at Jerusalem at the feast: for they also went unto the feast.
So*p Jesus came again into Cana of Galilee, where he made the water wine. And there was a certain nobleman, whose son was sick at Capernaum.
When*p he heard that Jesus was come out of Judaea into Galilee, he went unto him, and besought him that he would come down, and heal his son: for he was at the point of death.
Then*p said Jesus unto him, Except*r ye*r see*r signs*r and*r wonders,*r ye*r will*r not*r believe.*r
The*p nobleman saith unto him, Sir, come down ere my child die.
Jesus*p saith unto him, Go*r thy*r way;*r thy*r son*r liveth.*r And the man believed the word that Jesus had spoken unto him, and he went his way.
And*p as he was now going down, his servants met him, and told him, saying, Thy son liveth.
Then*p enquired he of them the hour when he began to amend. And they said unto him, Yesterday at the seventh hour the fever left him.
So*p the father knew that it was at the same hour, in the which Jesus said unto him, Thy*r son*r liveth:*r and himself believed, and his whole house.
This*p is again the second miracle that Jesus did, when he was come out of Judaea into Galilee.
John 5
After*p this there was a feast of the Jews; and Jesus went up to Jerusalem.
Now*p there is at Jerusalem by the sheep market a pool, which is called in the Hebrew tongue Bethesda, having five porches.
In*p these lay a great multitude of impotent folk, of blind, halt, withered, waiting for the moving of the water.
For*p an angel went down at a certain season into the pool, and troubled the water: whosoever then first after the troubling of the water stepped in was made whole of whatsoever disease he had.
And*p a certain man was there, which had an infirmity thirty and eight years.
When*p Jesus saw him lie, and knew that he had been now a long time in that case, he saith unto him, Wilt*r thou*r be*r made*r whole?*r
The*p impotent man answered him, Sir, I have no man, when the water is troubled, to put me into the pool: but while I am coming, another steppeth down before me.
Jesus*p saith unto him, Rise,*r take*r up*r thy*r bed,*r and*r walk.*r
And*p immediately the man was made whole, and took up his bed, and walked: and on the same day was the sabbath.
The*p Jews therefore said unto him that was cured, It is the sabbath day: it is not lawful for thee to carry thy bed.
He*p answered them, He that made me whole, the same said unto me, Take*r up*r thy*r bed,*r and*r walk.*r
Then*p asked they him, What man is that which said unto thee, Take*r up*r thy*r bed,*r and*r walk?*r
And*p he that was healed wist not who it was: for Jesus had conveyed himself away, a multitude being in that place.
Afterward*p Jesus findeth him in the temple, and said unto him, Behold,*r thou*r art*r made*r whole:*r sin*r no*r more,*r lest*r a*r worse*r thing*r come*r unto*r thee.*r
The*p man departed, and told the Jews that it was Jesus, which had made him whole.
And*p therefore did the Jews persecute Jesus, and sought to slay him, because he had done these things on the sabbath day.
But*p Jesus answered them, My*r Father*r worketh*r hitherto,*r and*r I*r work.*r
Therefore*p the Jews sought the more to kill him, because he not only had broken the sabbath, but said also that God was his Father, making himself equal with God.

Then*p answered Jesus and said unto them, Verily,*r verily,*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r The*r Son*r can*r do*r nothing*r of*r himself,*r but*r what*r he*r seeth*r the*r Father*r do:*r for*r what*r things*r soever*r he*r doeth,*r these*r also*r doeth*r the*r Son*r likewise.*r
For*rp the*r Father*r loveth*r the*r Son,*r and*r sheweth*r him*r all*r things*r that*r himself*r doeth:*r and*r he*r will*r shew*r him*r greater*r works*r than*r these,*r that*r ye*r may*r marvel.*r
For*rp as*r the*r Father*r raiseth*r up*r the*r dead,*r and*r quickeneth*r them;*r even*r so*r the*r Son*r quickeneth*r whom*r he*r will.*r
For*rp the*r Father*r judgeth*r no*r man,*r but*r hath*r committed*r all*r judgment*r unto*r the*r Son:*r
That*rp all*r men*r should*r honour*r the*r Son,*r even*r as*r they*r honour*r the*r Father.*r He*r that*r honoureth*r not*r the*r Son*r honoureth*r not*r the*r Father*r which*r hath*r sent*r him.*r

Verily,*rp verily,*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r He*r that*r heareth*r my*r word,*r and*r believeth*r on*r him*r that*r sent*r me,*r hath*r everlasting*r life,*r and*r shall*r not*r come*r into*r condemnation;*r but*r is*r passed*r from*r death*r unto*r life.*r

Verily,*rp verily,*r I*r say*r unto*r you,*r The*r hour*r is*r coming,*r and*r now*r is,*r when*r the*r dead*r shall*r hear*r the*r voice*r of*r the*r Son*r of*r God:*r and*r they*r that*r hear*r shall*r live.*r
For*rp as*r the*r Father*r hath*r life*r in*r himself;*r so*r hath*r he*r given*r to*r the*r Son*r to*r have*r life*r in*r himself;*r
And*rp hath*r given*r him*r authority*r to*r execute*r judgment*r also,*r because*r he*r is*r the*r Son*r of*r man.*r
Marvel*rp not*r at*r this:*r for*r the*r hour*r is*r coming,*r in*r the*r which*r all*r that*r are*r in*r the*r graves*r shall*r hear*r his*r voice,*r
And*rp shall*r come*r forth;*r they*r that*r have*r done*r good,*r unto*r the*r resurrection*r of*r life;*r and*r they*r that*r have*r done*r evil,*r unto*r the*r resurrection*r of*r damnation.*r

I*rp can*r of*r mine*r own*r self*r do*r nothing:*r as*r I*r hear,*r I*r judge:*r and*r my*r judgment*r is*r just;*r because*r I*r seek*r not*r mine*r own*r will,*r but*r the*r will*r of*r the*r Father*r which*r hath*r sent*r me.*r
If*rp I*r bear*r witness*r of*r myself,*r my*r witness*r is*r not*r true.*r

John 18
When*p Jesus had spoken these words, he went forth with his disciples over the brook Cedron, where was a garden, into the which he entered, and his disciples.
And*p Judas also, which betrayed him, knew the place: for Jesus ofttimes resorted thither with his disciples.

Jesus*p saith unto her, Woman,*r why*r weepest*r thou?*r whom*r seekest*r thou?*r She, supposing him to be the gardener, saith unto him, Sir, if thou have borne him hence, tell me where thou hast laid him, and I will take him away.

Jesus*p saith unto her, Touch*r me*r not;*r for*r I*r am*r not*r yet*r ascended*r to*r my*r Father:*r but*r go*r to*r my*r brethren,*r and*r say*r unto*r them,*r I*r ascend*r unto*r my*r Father,*r and*r your*r Father;*r and*r to*r my*r God,*r and*r your*r God.*r
Mary*p Magdalene came and told the disciples that she had seen the Lord, and that he had spoken these things unto her.

Then*p the same day at evening, being the first day of the week, when the doors were shut where the disciples were assembled for fear of the Jews, came Jesus and stood in the midst, and saith unto them, Peace*r be*r unto*r you.*r
And*p when he had so said, he shewed unto them his hands and his side. Then were the disciples glad, when they saw the Lord.
Then*p said Jesus to them again, Peace*r be*r unto*r you:*r as*r my*r Father*r hath*r sent*r me,*r even*r so*r send*r I*r you.*r
And*p when he had said this, he breathed on them, and saith unto them, Receive*r ye*r the*r Holy*r Ghost:*r
Whose*rp soever*r sins*r ye*r remit,*r they*r are*r remitted*r unto*r them;*r and*r whose*r soever*r sins*r ye*r retain,*r they*r are*r retained.*r
But*p Thomas, one of the twelve, called Didymus, was not with them when Jesus came.

The*p other disciples therefore said unto him, We have seen the Lord. But he said unto them, Except I shall see in his hands the print of the nails, and put my finger into the print of the nails, and thrust my hand into his side, I will not believe.
And*p after eight days again his disciples were within, and Thomas with them: then came Jesus, the doors being shut, and stood in the midst, and said, Peace*r be*r unto*r you.*r

Then*p saith he to Thomas, Reach*r hither*r thy*r finger,*r and*r behold*r my*r hands;*r and*r reach*r hither*r thy*r hand,*r and*r thrust*r it*r into*r my*r side:*r and*r be*r not*r faithless,*r but*r believing.*r
And*p Thomas answered and said unto him, My Lord and my God.
Jesus*p saith unto him, Thomas,*r because*r thou*r hast*r seen*r me,*r thou*r hast*r believed:*r blessed*r are*r they*r that*r have*r not*r seen,*r and*r yet*r have*r believed.*r
And*p many other signs truly did Jesus in the presence of his disciples, which are not written in this book:
But*p these are written, that ye might believe that Jesus is the Christ, the Son of God; and that believing ye might have life through his name.
John 21
After*p these things Jesus shewed himself again to the disciples at the sea of Tiberias; and on this wise shewed he himself.
There*p were together Simon Peter, and Thomas called Didymus, and Nathanael of Cana in Galilee, and the sons of Zebedee, and two other of his disciples.
Simon*p Peter saith unto them, I go a fishing. They say unto him, We also go with thee. They went forth, and entered into a ship immediately; and that night they caught nothing.
But*p when the morning was now come, Jesus stood on the shore: but the disciples knew not that it was Jesus.
Then*p Jesus saith unto them, Children,*r have*r ye*r any*r meat?*r They answered him, No.

And*p he said unto them, Cast*r the*r net*r on*r the*r right*r side*r of*r the*r ship,*r and*r ye*r shall*r find.*r They cast therefore, and now they were not able to draw it for the multitude of fishes.

Therefore*p that disciple whom Jesus loved saith unto Peter, It is the Lord. Now when Simon Peter heard that it was the Lord, he girt his fisher's coat unto him, (for he was naked,) and did cast himself into the sea.
And*p the other disciples came in a little ship; (for they were not far from land, but as it were two hundred cubits,) dragging the net with fishes.
As*p soon then as they were come to land, they saw a fire of coals there, and fish laid thereon, and bread.
Jesus*p saith unto them, Bring*r of*r the*r fish*r which*r ye*r have*r now*r caught.*r
Simon*p Peter went up, and drew the net to land full of great fishes, an hundred and fifty and three: and for all there were so many, yet was not the net broken.
Jesus*p saith unto them, Come*r and*r dine.*r And none of the disciples durst ask him, Who art thou? knowing that it was the Lord.
Jesus*p then cometh, and taketh bread, and giveth them, and fish likewise.
This*p is now the third time that Jesus shewed himself to his disciples, after that he was risen from the dead.

So*p when they had dined, Jesus saith to Simon Peter, Simon,*r son*r of*r Jonas,*r lovest*r thou*r me*r more*r than*r these?*r He saith unto him, Yea, Lord; thou knowest that I love thee. He saith unto him, Feed*r my*r lambs.*r
He*p saith to him again the second time, Simon,*r son*r of*r Jonas,*r lovest*r thou*r me?*r He saith unto him, Yea, Lord; thou knowest that I love thee. He saith unto him, Feed*r my*r sheep.*r

He*p saith unto him the third time, Simon,*r son*r of*r Jonas,*r lovest*r thou*r me?*r Peter was grieved because he said unto him the third time, Lovest thou me? And he said unto him, Lord, thou knowest all things; thou knowest that I love thee. Jesus saith unto him, Feed*r my*r sheep.*r

Verily,*rp verily,*r I*r say*r unto*r thee,*r When*r thou*r wast*r young,*r thou*r girdedst*r thyself,*r and*r walkedst*r whither*r thou*r wouldest:*r but*r when*r thou*r shalt*r be*r old,*r thou*r shalt*r stretch*r forth*r thy*r hands,*r and*r another*r shall*r gird*r thee,*r and*r carry*r thee*r whither*r thou*r wouldest*r not.*r
This*p spake he, signifying by what death he should glorify God. And when he had spoken this, he saith unto him, Follow*r me.*r
Then*p Peter, turning about, seeth the disciple whom Jesus loved following; which also leaned on his breast at supper, and said, Lord, which is he that betrayeth thee?
Peter*p seeing him saith to Jesus, Lord, and what shall this man do?
Jesus*p saith unto him, If*r I*r will*r that*r he*r tarry*r till*r I*r come,*r what*r is*r that*r to*r thee?*r follow*r thou*r me.*r

Then*p went this saying abroad among the brethren, that that disciple should not die: yet Jesus said not unto him, He shall not die; but, If*r I*r will*r that*r he*r tarry*r till*r I*r come,*r what*r is*r that*r to*r thee?*r
This*p is the disciple which testifieth of these things, and wrote these things: and we know that his testimony is true.
And*p there are also many other things which Jesus did, the which, if they should be written every one, I suppose that even the world itself could not contain the books that should be written. Amen.
